name: places/ChIJj4iQJCf3wokRSsatwsyfULU
formattedAddress: 813 W 187th St, New York, NY 10040, USA
adrFormatAddress: 813 W 187th St, New York, NY 10040, USA

originalText.text:
I came here, very excited to try this place out for breakfast/brunch. When I approached the hostess, I told her I'd like to dine in. She told me to go place my order at the register first. Upon approaching the register, they assumed I was ordering to go since I didn't have a table. There seemed to be some kind of miscommunication between the hostess and the register as to why she would have sent me to them first. I ordered french toast along with two eggs and was given a table number. I assumed I just had to seat myself, which I did once a table became available. I thought I would receive a glass of water, but I also had to get that myself.

My eggs came out within 10 minutes. I had assumed they would come out at the same time as my French toast, so I decided to wait. I waited nearly 30 minutes and was asked twice if "everything was ok?". Both times I told them I was still waiting on my food and that I wanted to eat the items together. By the time the French toast came out, it was lukewarm at best, and my eggs were completely cold. It was not good. At this point I had been waiting at the restaurant for nearly an hour. I took about two bites of my food before being asked again if "everything was okay". I explained to them that the food was cold and not good. They offered to either take care of part of the check or replace the items. I was very disappointed by the service already but also extremely hungry. I let the server know that a replacement would be okay but only if it wasn't going to take another hour to come out. She told me she spoke with her manager and that my order would be next up.

By the time I got a hot plate of food, I was already very turned off and disappointed in the whole experience. But I will say it was tasty.

(I also thought the french toast would come with strawberries or blueberries based on photos I saw, but it was topped with apples and almonds.)

I would potentially come back to try their pastries are baked goods, but not necessarily to dine in again.

originalText.text:
I was craving a Dutch baby so decided to try theirs. I will the only reason they lost a star is because of the lack of variety of their Dutch babies. They only have a singular Dutch baby to choose from in a place named after this dish. So I hope this might inspire them to expand their selection of only by a little.
Don’t mind the photo of the half pastry it looked so good we couldn’t wait to eat it. The food we ordered was delicious and extremely satisfying, the Dutch baby was large enough to split between two people so it is totally worth the price. The staff was helpful in suggestions and seems to have a decent knowledge of the menu which seems easy enough but you would be surprised how rare it is to find people fully versed in the menu.
I loved the low key atmosphere here and would highly recommend this spot to anyone who likes good food.

originalText.text: I had a take out - small latte and a selection of scones and I must say all pastries are DELICIOUS!!! Coffee was also great - smooth and not too strong / burnt. Definitely coming back to try other pastries and for the scones of course! Yummm

text.text: I had a take out - small latte and a selection of scones and I must say all pastries are DELICIOUS!!! Coffee was also great - smooth and not too strong / burnt. Definitely coming back to try other pastries and for the scones of course! Yummm

originalText.text: A cozy cafe in the hills of Washington Heights. I stopped by to grab a latte, it was worth the $6 bucks, great quality. The baked goods looked really good as well, they have a space next door where they host small events as well. It took a few minutes to grab my latte since there was only 1 person but they were nice and the shop was about to close up either way. Highly recommend anyone to stop and support this local shop!

originalText.text:
I just recently visited Dutch Baby Bakery for the first time & it was a great experience! I only stayed briefly, as I just came to pick-up a half dozen cupcakes for my work colleagues to enjoy, but the service was efficient and the atmosphere in the bakery seemed really cute! The cupcakes they had available on the day of my visit were carrot and were absolutely delicious. I'm excited to pop-in for a longer visit in the future to order breakfast or coffee with a pastry - this seemed like a great spot to read the NY Times in the morning over coffee!

UPDATE (1/7/2024): Happy to report that Dutch Baby met all expectations after returning for coffee + food for dine-in!! I’ve been back multiple times since I wrote my original review and it is always a great experience! :-) Try their Apple Cider Donut, the Avocado Toast, and the ABQ Benny!!
